body_html:
hi, the build issue has been fixed. Previously i wasn't aware that aten needs to be able to be built outside pytorch, so i didn't handle the cmake properly.

After the fix, both pytorch and aten isn't hard rely on mkldnn.
user can explicitly disable mkldnn by export NO_MKLDNN=1, similar to the way of disabling cuda by export NO_CUDA=1. Also, if conda doesn't have mkldnn installed, pytorch and aten can also be built properly.

To enable mkldnn build, need to pre-install mkldnn via conda install -c mingfeima mkldnn

body:
hi, the build issue has been fixed. Previously i wasn't aware that aten needs to be able to be built outside pytorch, so i didn't handle the cmake properly.

After the fix, both pytorch and aten isn't hard rely on mkldnn.
user can explicitly disable mkldnn by `export NO_MKLDNN=1`, similar to the way of disabling cuda by `export NO_CUDA=1`. Also, if conda doesn't have mkldnn installed, pytorch and aten can also be built properly.

To enable mkldnn build, need to pre-install mkldnn via `conda install -c mingfeima mkldnn`
